content.raw:
I'm currently working on a plugin that uses MultiRayShapeClass I had an error saying that there is no Ray method on the class. I need to get the Ray member, that is protected, using the following method:

```
#!c++
RayShapePtr 	Ray (const unsigned int _rayIndex) const 
```
Eventhough it is present in the  [documentation of api  7.1](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/7.1.0/classgazebo_1_1physics_1_1MultiRayShape.html), I did not found it in the source code of [Gazebo 7.14](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/gazebo7_7.14.0/gazebo/physics/MultiRayShape.hh)( **My Target Version**). Doing a little research I found it on source code of [api 9.0](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/gazebo9_9.0.0/gazebo/physics/MultiRayShape.hh). Am I doing something wrong? is there a way get Rays without moving to Gazebo 9.0 or recompiling Gazebo?

Thanks!
content.html:
I'm currently working on a plugin that uses MultiRayShapeClass I had an error saying that there is no Ray method on the class. I need to get the Ray member, that is protected, using the following method:

RayShapePtr     Ray (const unsigned int _rayIndex) const

Eventhough it is present in the documentation of api 7.1, I did not found it in the source code of Gazebo 7.14( My Target Version). Doing a little research I found it on source code of api 9.0. Am I doing something wrong? is there a way get Rays without moving to Gazebo 9.0 or recompiling Gazebo?

Thanks!
